segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing; the sink is overflowing, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not notice the water pouring onto the floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's in a trance, completely unaware of her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids, they're just as bad, focused on their cookies instead of the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel my frustration growing as I watch the scene unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to do something before the whole kitchen is flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't understand how they can all be so oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're in their own little worlds, ignoring the chaos around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope someone snaps out of it soon and turns off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR
